chargeHist.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)
Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer]. The defendant was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] was dismissed by the court.

  • Peter S. Schmidt was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant IS Eligible for Challenge Incarceration and Substance Abuse Programs. Sentence credit of 147 days were granted.

superMiscConds.notes: Fine to be paid as a condition of Extended Supervision.
Costs to be paid as a condition of Extended Supervision.   Reimbursement for Blood Draw costs to be paid/forwarded to Waukesha Co Clerk of Courts for Village of Menomonee Falls Police Dept.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are ordered.
Perform Alcohol Assessment.
ATTEND the Victim Impact Panel meeting as a condition of Extended Supervision.

Provide DNA Specimen unless previously obtained. Surcharge is imposed. Maintain employment and/or school combination. Follow through with any treatment or counseling recommended by agent.
  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

supervisions.notes: Ignition Interlock to be installed on every vehicle OPERATED, TITLED OR REGISTERED to the defendant.

Defendant Peter S. Schmidt in court with Attorney Mark P Murphy.  Pablo Galaviz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count #1.  Court performs plea colloquy and finds Defendant guilty of Count #1.  Count #2 is dismissed and read-in.  Count #3 is dismissed by operation of law.  State gives sentencing recommendations.  Attorney Murphy makes statements regarding sentencing. Defendant makes statements.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #1:  IMPOSED SENTENCE OF:   

4  YEARS IMPRISONMENT (CREDIT - 147 days)
  -  2 YEARS OF INITIAL CONFINEMENT
  -  2 YEARS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION;

*D/L REVOCATION:  36 months.
*IGNITION INTERLOCK:  36 months.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
*AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
*Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
*Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
*DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done 
*Attend Victim Impact Panel

BLOOD DRAW FEE:  $60.00  (to be paid as a condition of probation - to be forward to Menomonee Falls Police Department);

TELEPHONIC SEARCH WARRANT FEE:  $12.00 (to be paid as a condition of probation - to be forward to Waukesha County District Attorney's Office)

FINE:  $2,277.00 & $250.00 DNA surcharge (to be paid as a condition of probation);

Defendant is eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is eligible for Substance Abuse Program.

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
Plea/sentencing hearing on December 19, 2014 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Peter S. Schmidt in court with Attorney Mark P Murphy.  Margaret Drees appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case called for plea and sentence hearing, however Attorney Murphy requests an adjournment due to having to further review discovery he received from Attorney Kershek.  State does not object to an adjournment. Court adjourns.   Bail remains as fixed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 19, 2014 at 02:30 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on November 17, 2014 at 03:15 pm.

Defendant Peter S. Schmidt in court with Attorney Mark P Murphy.  Ted S. Szczupakiewicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State files an amended information.  Attorney Murphy enters a not guilty plea on behalf of Defendant to all counts on amended information and requests an adjournment for plea and sentence.  Court grants request.  Bail remains as fixed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 17, 2014 at 03:15 pm.
Hearing on October 13, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
(Fax) Dated 09/29/14, from Atty Murphy to Judge Carter, requesting adjournment of 10/03/14 hearing.
Hearing on October 3, 2014 at 10:00 am.

Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.   Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed. Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.  Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services (WCS) Intoxicated Driver Program  Defendant ordered to SCRAM monitoring.  Defendant to pay costs associated with SCRAM monitoring.  Defendants who can not  pay will be required to follow an enhanced level of direct supervision requirements as established by WCS.  WCS will notify the Court.  Defendant to be released directly/only to Wisconsin Community Services personnel to set-up SCRAM monitoring. MODIFIED CONDITION: DEFENDANT ALLOWED HUBER BAILEE STATUS.

Defendant Peter S. Schmidt in court, in custody, with attorney Mark P Murphy. Atty Kevin M. Osborne appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case called for Bail Motion. Atty Murphy requests modification of bail. State objects to any bail modification. Court denies modification of bail, however grants huber bailee status.  Hearing scheduled for October 3, 2014 at 10:00 am.

Bail/bond hearing on September 3, 2014 at 10:00 am.
